1799-04-13 Covent Garden

Title
1799-04-13 Covent Garden
Item Identifier
lsidyv3fa2a8c1_1797-1800_Covent_Garden_Playbills_0146
Archive Holding Document
British Library
Announcements

Venue: Covent Garden
Location: London
Date: 1799-04-13

The Birth Day

Genre: Comedy
Genre tag: Comedy
Author (Altered from the German of Kotzebue): Kotzebue

Divertisement

Genre:
Genre tag: Interlude
:

A Rural Masquerade

Genre: Masquerade
Genre tag: Interlude
Composer of a new song, "Poor Orra come from distant shore": Mr. Mazzinghi

Raymond and Agnes; Or, The Castle of Lindenbergh

Genre: Grand Serious Ballet (interspersed with Songs & Chorusses)
Genre tag: Ballet
Composer, overture and music: Mr. Reeve
Composer, ballet: Mr. Farley

Cast List for The Birth Day

Mr. Munden as
Mr. Fawcett as
Mr. H. Johnston as (Delivered prologue)
Mr. Murray as
Mr. Waddy as
Mr. Davenport as
Mrs. Whitmore as
Mrs. Pope as (Delivered epilogue)

Cast List for Divertisement

Mr. Simmons as Singing, Peggy Perkins, "Let Bards elate, &c."
Mr Waddy as Singing, Irish Drinking Song, "Of the ancient its speaking, &c."; speaking character
Mr. Townsend as Singing, "I went to Sea"; speaking character
Mrs. Martyr as Singing, Taffy and Griddy, "Abergavenny is fine"; speaking character
Mr. Incledon as (Singing, "The moment Aarora", "Dear Mary adieu", and "The Midnight Watch"; speaking character)
Mr. Emery as Speaking character
Mr. Simmons as Speaking character
Mr. Clarke as Speaking character
Mrs. Mills as Speaking character
Mr. Rees as Speaking character

Cast List for A Rural Masquerade

Miss Waters as Singer, "Poor Orra come from distant shore"
Mrs. Mills as Singer, Sea Song, "A sailor's life's a life of woe, &c."
Mr. Waddy as Singer, The Masquerade, "Sure an't the World a Masquerade" (With chorus)
Mr. Blurton as Ballet
Mrs. Watts as Ballet

Cast List for Raymond and Agnes; Or, The Castle of Lindenbergh

Mr. Farley as Don Raymond
Mr. Bologna, Jun. as Robert (A robber)
Mr. Blurton as Jaques (A robber)
Mr. King as Claud (A Postillion and one of the Banditti)
Mr. Hawtin as Don Felix (Father to Raymond)
Mr. Dyke as Count of Lindenbergh
Mr. Simmons as Theodore (Page to Raymond)
Mr. Whitmore as Father Ansellum
Mr. Thompson as Master of Hotel
Mr. Street as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Linton as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Thomas as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Curries as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Little as Friar / Mulleteer and choral boy
Mr. Oddwell as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Everett as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Sawyer as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. J. Linton as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Lee as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Ruffe as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Smith as Friar / Mulleteer
Mr. Ramage as Choral boy
Mr. Goodwin as Choral boy
Mr. Slape as Choral boy
Mr. Bernard as Choral boy
Mr. Platt as Choral boy
Mr. Speare as Choral boy
Mr. Sawyer as Choral boy
Mrs. Mills as Maugerette (Baptist's mistress)
Mrs. Watts as Spectre of the Bleeding Nun (Mother of Agnes)
Mrs. Follett as Countess of Lindenbergh (Step mother to Agnes)
Mrs. Burnet as Annette
Mrs. Platt as Abbess of St. Claire
Mrs. Chapman as Agnes (Daughter to the Count of Lindenbergh)
Madame Sims as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Castelle as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Iliff as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Leserve as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Walcup as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Lloyd as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Norton as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Madame Masters as Nun of the Convent of St. Clair
Mr. Platt as Domestic
Mr. Wilde as Domestic
Mr. L. Bologna as Domestic
Mr. Jackson as Domestic
Mr. Webb as Domestic
Mr. Chapman as Domestic
Mr. Abbot as Domestic
Mr. Goostree as Domestic
Mr. Howell as Domestic
